_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: BeamMP
author: leogauthier26@gmail.com

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash

# Install package requirements
apt -y update
apt -y install wget unzip build-essential zlib1g-dev git

# Installing OpenSSL (new dependency since new BeamMP server version)
git clone https://github.com/openssl/openssl.git
cd openssl && ./Configure && make && make install
ldconfig
openssl version

# Move to server directory
mkdir /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

# Default config
echo '
# This is the BeamMP-Server config file.
# Help & Documentation: `https://wiki.beammp.com/en/home/server-maintenance`
# IMPORTANT: Fill in the AuthKey with the key you got from `https://beammp.com/k/dashboard` on the left under "Keys"

[General]
Name = "BeamMP Server"
Port = 30814
# AuthKey has to be filled out in order to run the server
AuthKey = ""
# Whether to log chat messages in the console / log
LogChat = true
Debug = false
Private = true
MaxCars = 1
MaxPlayers = 8
Map = "/levels/gridmap_v2/info.json"
Description = "BeamMP Default Description"
ResourceFolder = "Resources"

[Misc]
# Hides the periodic update message which notifies you of a new server version. You should really keep this on and always update as soon as possible. For more information visit https://wiki.beammp.com/en/home/server-maintenance#updating-the-server. An update message will always appear at startup regardless.
ImScaredOfUpdates = false
# If SendErrors is `true`, the server will send helpful info about crashes and other issues back to the BeamMP developers. This info may include your config, who is on your server at the time of the error, and similar general information. This kind of data is vital in helping us diagnose and fix issues faster. This has no impact on server performance. You can opt-out of this system by setting this to `false`
SendErrorsShowMessage = true
# You can turn on/off the SendErrors message you get on startup here
SendErrors = true

[HTTP]
# Which IP to listen on. Pick 0.0.0.0 for a public-facing server with no specific IP, and 127.0.0.1 or 'localhost' for a local server.
HTTPServerIP = "127.0.0.1"
SSLKeyPath = "./.ssl/HttpServer/key.pem"
SSLCertPath = "./.ssl/HttpServer/cert.pem"
HTTPServerPort = 8080
# Recommended to have enabled for servers which face the internet. With SSL the server will serve https and requires valid key and cert files
UseSSL = false
# Enables the internal HTTP server
HTTPServerEnabled = false
' >> ServerConfig.toml

wget https://github.com/BeamMP/BeamMP-Server/releases/latest/download/BeamMP-Server-linux
mv BeamMP-Server-linux BeamMP-Server
chmod +x BeamMP-Server

variables.name: Max cars
variables.description:
Maximum amount of cars per player. 
Value between 1 and 5.

variables.name: Max players
variables.description:
Maximum amount of players that can join the server.
Value between 1 and 20

variables.name: Map
variables.description:
Which map the server will use. Must restart the server to change this value.
See reference for a list of maps: https://wiki.beammp.com/en/home/server-maintenance
Value is a string of max 255 char length.

variables.name: Name
variables.description:
The name of your BeamMP server (will show on the public list if you didn't set private to true).
Value is a string of max 350 char length.

variables.name: Description
variables.description:
The description of your BeamMP server (will show on the public list if you didn't set private to true).
Value is a string of max 500 char length.

variables.name: Authentication Key
variables.description:
Your BeamMP Server authentication key. 
Get one here: https://beammp.com/keymaster
Value is a string of max 64 char length.

variables.name: Private
variables.description:
Is this a private server? Private servers will not show up on the server list.
Value can either be true or false.

variables.name: Debug mode
variables.description:
Run the server in debug mode? 
Value can either be true or false.

variables.name: Resource
variables.description:
Resource folder location (full or relative path).
Value is a string of max 128 char length.

variables.name: Log the chat
variables.description:
Whether or not you want to log chat messages in the console / log.
Value can either be true or false.

variables.name: Hide update notifications
variables.description:
Hides the periodic update message which notifies you of a new server version.
Value can either be true or false.

variables.name: Show errors on crash
variables.description: If set to true, the server will send helpful info about crashes and other issues back to the BeamMP developers. This info may include your config, who is on your server at the time of the error, and similar general information. This kind of data is vital in helping us diagnose and fix issues faster. This has no impact on server performance. You can opt-out of this system by setting this to false.

variables.name: Show errors on startup
variables.description:
You can turn on/off the SendErrors message you get on server startup here.
Value can either be true or false.

variables.name: HTTP Server IP
variables.description:
Which IP to listen on. Pick 0.0.0.0 for a public-facing server with no specific IP, and 127.0.0.1 or 'localhost' for a local server.
Value must be a valid IPv4 (ex: 192.168.1.1).

variables.name: Use SSL
variables.description:
Recommended to have enabled for servers which face the internet. With SSL the server will serve https and requires valid key and cert files.
Value can either be true or false.

variables.name: SSL Key Path
variables.description:
The full path to your SSL key (if you enabled SSL).
Value is a string of max 128 char length.

variables.name: SSLCertPath
variables.description:
The full path to your SSL cert (if you enabled SSL).
Value is a string of max 128 char length.

variables.name: HTTP Server Port
variables.description:
The port to the internal HTTP server.
Value must be a valid port (between 1 and 65535).

variables.name: HTTP Server Enabled
variables.description:
Enables the internal HTTP server.
Value can either be true or false.
